meanings.definition: An establishment for the medical treatment and recuperation of people who are chronically ill or convalescing.
meanings.sent1: The old sanitarium in the mountains provided a peaceful place for patients to recover.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother spent a month at the sanitarium after her surgery.
meanings.sent3: The sanitarium was so quiet that even the birds seemed to whisper.
meanings.sent4: Her mind became a sanitarium of memories, each room filled with moments from the past.
meanings.sent5: The white walls of the sanitarium glowed in the sunlight, a beacon of hope for the sick.

meanings.definition: A facility for the care and treatment of people with mental illness.
meanings.sent1: The new sanitarium in town offers specialized care for those struggling with mental health issues.
meanings.sent2: He visited his friend at the sanitarium every weekend to provide support.
meanings.sent3: The quirky doctor at the sanitarium always wore mismatched socks to make his patients smile.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled like a storm inside the sanitarium of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sanitarium stood tall against the backdrop of the city, a symbol of healing for many.
